intro: Hibbertia montana, commonly known as the mountain hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and distinctive leaf structure. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Hibbertia montana has hairy stems and elliptical leaves with a waxy coating. It is often found in regions of New South Wales and Victoria.
